questions.question: What type of instrument would you use to measure the mass of an object?

choices.answer: Graduated cylinder
Balance
Ruler
Beaker

questions.question: Which of the following are important factors when creating a graph?

choices.answer: Must have a title
Must have a key
A scale the has a consistent interval
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of matter?

choices.answer: Light
Air
Sound
The downward pull of gravity on an object.
The amount of space that an object occupies.
The amount of matter in a given volume of  a substance.
How much matter an object contains.
The downward pull of gravity on an object.
The amount of space that an object occupies.
The amount of matter in a given volume of a substance.
How much matter an object contains.
The downward pull of gravity on an object.
The amount of space that an object occupies.
The amount of matter in a given volume of a substance.
How much matter an object contains.

The amount of space that an object occupies.
The amount of matter in a given volume of a substance.
How much matter an object contains.

questions.question: When an object changes from one state of matter to another, what is changing?

choices.answer: The molecules are changing into a new substance.
The molecules are moving from high conc. to low conc.
The arrangement of the molecules is changing.
The amount of molecules is changing.

questions.question: What causes substances to change from one state of matter to another?

choices.answer: Change in the number of molecules.
Change in the type of molecules.
Change in the grouping of the molecules.
Change in the temperature of the molecules.

questions.question: What does a substance's melting point and freezing point have in common?

choices.answer: They are the same for all substances.
They are the same temperature for individual substances.
They are 32 degrees Fahrenheit for all substances.
They are when substances turn from a liquid into a gas.
When a solid changes directly into a gas.
When a solid changes into a liquid.
When a liquid changes into a solid.
When a liquid changes into a gas.
The amount of radiation an object can absorb.
The distance the liquid in a thermometer moves.
The concept that objects expand when heated.
The average kinetic energy of the particles in an object.
From cold to hot.
From hot to cold.
It depends on the object.

questions.question: Which of the following is true of thermal expansion?

choices.answer: It occurs only in solids.
It occurs only in liquids.
It occurs only in gases.
It can occur in solids, liquids, and gases.
